Description:
Sophisticated single-level, inner-city sanctuary
A revelation of quality, style and sophistication, this stunning 4 bedroom single-level residence unfolds with perfect architectural poise in a highly coveted inner-city pocket. Unexpected pleasures are revealed with every step through this skilfully renovated, solid brick Victorian designed for high-end, low-up keep living and secluded alfresco entertaining. A secure rear garden and entertainment area bathing in sunshine is accessed through double-glazed stacker doors from a spacious living and dining zone warmed by HeatnGlo gas fireplace. The stone kitchen boasts induction cooktop and WI pantry while accommodation includes main bedroom with WIR and beautiful ensuite. Offers chic bathroom, hydronic heating, a-c and OSP. Excellent proximity to cafes, shops, parks/trails, trains and schools.
Insights: 59 Dwyer Street, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2019 and 10 other 4 bedroom house in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
Classic 2 street frontage Edwardian in the heart of the Village
This neatly presented Edwardian residence offers comfortable living in a prime position with second frontage to George Street, close to Village cafes, station and leading schools. With wonderful scope for future enhancement, abundant light and classic period detail, the home offers two double bedrooms (BIRs) opening from an arched hallway; a spacious central sitting room with side courtyard access, well-equipped kitchen open to a sunny northerly living/dining room & courtyard; large semi-ensuite bathroom & laundry. Including a carport/workshop, this appealing home features several OFPs, ornate ceilings and ducted heating. Nelson Alexander Pty Ltd
Insights: 74 Spensley Street, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2019 and 16 other 2 bedroom house in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
Open This Saturday
In a converted warehouse building, this spacious, fully appointed and rebuilt apartment offers accommodation that is rarely found in such a spectacular inner city location. Within easy access to public transport, parklands and Queens Parade shopping and soaked in spectacular northern light, the apartment offers every modern convenience and is sure to be one of the best buying decisions you ever make. Accommodation includes a large bedroom with built in storage, spacious open plan living and dining, galley style kitchen, secure garage car parking spot with remote access & a lockup storage room. Further features include polished concrete floors, air conditioning/heating, courtyard area and an enviable location. "Please note: Photos displayed are from a previous sales campaign".
Insights: 92A Roseneath Street, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2019.

Description:
Striking Terrace Zoned for Clifton Hill Primary
Superbly set on a deep block with off-street parking; discover an outstanding opportunity with this beautifully renovated and extended 3-bedroom, 2-bathroom Hawthorn brick terrace offering rich lifestyle rewards just metres to the Darling Gardens and Clifton Hill Primary School. There's plenty to enjoy with this character-filled Victorian complemented by modern miele kitchen with ample storage, open plan living/dining, separate upstairs study, central bathroom, hydronic heating, reverse-cycle air-conditioning, polished boards, open fireplaces and lots more. Also central to Queens Parade, Smith/Brunswick Streets, trams and train with easy access into the CBD.
Insights: 128 Gold Street, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2019 and 25 other 3 bedroom house in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
Period Presence in the Heart of Clifton Hill
Original elegance, updated appeal and location perfection illustrate the allure of this semi-detached Edwardian home ensuring an environment of immediate quality and outstanding convenience with Clifton Hill's renowned lifestyle attractions all at your fingertips. Immaculately-presented interior showcases three spacious bedrooms and contemporary-style bathroom, wide central lounge leading through to the updated kitchen/meals area complete with tiled splashbacks and stainless steel cooking appliances. Other highlights of the home include gas heating and additional panel heaters, alarm system, towering ceilings, internal laundry facilities, plus a delightful rear courtyard with extensive decking, perimeter gardens and direct access to the rear ROW. A truly aspirational city-fringe location walking distance to village cafes, Clifton Hill Station and Queens Parade trams, as well as Darling Gardens, Quarry Park and Merri Creek/Yarra River trails.
Insights: 65 Ramsden Street, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2019 and 25 other 3 bedroom house in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
Classic double fronted Victorian home in a sought-after Clifton Hill street
This double fronted Victorian home presents an enviable inner city lifestyle along one of Clifton Hill's best streets, easy walking distance to Queens Parade shops and cafes, Darling Gardens and CBD trams. The tuckpointed faÃ§ade reveals an elegant formal lounge and dining room off the arched hallway, plus three generous bedrooms including the main with a walk-in robe. Further on is a bright bathroom with a shower over a bath. Enclosed by full height windows at the back is a spacious open plan living and dining area with a smart gas kitchen with stone benchtops, a stainless steel Smeg oven and dishwasher. The light filled living area is leading to a large entertaining terrace framed by landscaped gardens. Also outdoors is a separate workshop or studio, and an oversized double carport with ROW access. Features include a European laundry, ducted heating and split system a/c, an alarm, soaring ceilings with rosettes, polished floorboards, three ornate fireplaces and side access.
Insights: 389 Wellington Street, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2019 and 25 other 3 bedroom house in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
OPPORTUNITIES ABOUND... ELEVATED BRICK VICTORIAN
This picturesque period home offers comfortable accommodation throughout with enormous scope to create the dream home on this deep block with northern aspect.
- 2 bedrooms plus study (OFP)
- Entrance hall
- Good size living
- Separate dining
- Well-proportioned kitchen and bathroom
- Baltic pine floors and period detailing
- Land 5m x 37.5m approx.
Metres from Queens Parade cafes and shops. Darling Gardens and transport just around the corner. Moments to the CBD. This is a must see.
Conditions of entry - IDENTIFICATION and contact number required, otherwise entry may be refused.
The information about this property has been supplied to us by the property owner, while we have no cause to doubt its accuracy, we provide no guarantee. We cannot attest to the functionality of any fixtures, fittings or inclusions to the property. Land and apartment dimensions and floor/site plans are supplied by third parties. Typing mistakes, omissions, transposing can occur, we provide to assist but make no representation. Buyers must carry out their own due diligence.

Description:
Outstanding top floor apartment in a sought-after Clifton Hill pocket
Filled with natural light on the top floor of a boutique block, this outstanding apartment presents an ideal first home or investment opportunity in a sought-after Clifton Hill pocket. Footsteps from Yarra Bend Park, Merri Creek Trail and just a short walk to Clifton Hill Station, Queens Parade Village and cafes. Immaculately maintained throughout, it boasts a large living area with room for casual dining, and a smart functional kitchen offering gas cooking. Showcasing a large master bedroom with generous built-in robes, northerly district views and an ensuite with laundry facilities. In addition, this apartment features intercom entry and secure garaging for one car.
Insights: 9/32 Dwyer Street, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2019 and 12 other 1 bedroom unit in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
Sublime Entertainer In A Central Inner-City Locale
Take relaxed entertaining to the next level in a stylish and serene setting with this recently renovated apartment capturing natural light and sensational views towards the city skyline. Sublime single-level living and dining is superbly enhanced by a large covered balcony bathing in sunshine and a brilliantly remodelled kitchen that's the beating heart of the home with its top-line AEG/ASKO appliances, stone benchtops and smart storage. In fact, practical storage is a feature of this beautifully-designed, top-floor apartment and there's a lot of it. There are also two sizable bedrooms with built-in robes, stunning on-trend bathroom (heated towel rack), big European laundry, split-system heating/cooling and durable next-gen bamboo flooring. Securely accessed (1 of only 4) with intercom entrance, this spacious apartment with basement car space on title offers an exceptional, easy-care lifestyle in a central inner-city position near Queens Parade cafes, Darling Gardens, recreation centre, Merri Creek-Yarra River trails, city-fringe retail-restaurant precincts and Clifton Hill station for a quick and easy commute to the MCG, sports precinct and CBD.
Insights: 21 other 2 bedroom unit in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
Sun-filled style in a prized Yarra parklands pocket
This stunning modern townhouse is a brilliant discovery of natural light, stylish space and excellent quality while the immediate area's lifestyle attractions are yours to explore. Vast expanses of Yarra River parklands and trails lie just around the corner from this outstanding residence providing the perfect springboard to city-edge success near cafes, train station and inner-Melbourne's exciting restaurant precincts. A private entrance courtyard reveals this superb home's desirable design with 2 robed downstairs bedrooms (main with ensuite) matched by dining area, premium gourmet stone kitchen and sun-drenched living room opening to north-facing entertainment balcony. There's also an immaculate main bathroom, laundry, heating/cooling, beautiful floorboards, storage and internal garage

Description:
Sophisticated Townhouse Living Adjacent Parklands
A stylish renovation showcasing high-end interiors makes this sophisticated three bedroom town residence a chic home base. Adjacent Ramsden Reserve and Quarries Park, near Spensley St Primary, Clifton Hill Station, bike trails and range of local cafes this immaculate home impresses with its spacious interiors and clean modern aesthetic. A designer soft-close CaesarStone kitchen featuring 700mm Smeg cooking and Miele dishwasher oversees expansive living and dining where a dramatic pitched ceiling creates a bright airy ambience and the accompanying north-facing balcony provides an outdoor space to enjoy, with communal pool and barbeque facilities assuring exceptional summer entertaining and relaxation. Two stylishly appointed bathrooms complement bedrooms with BIRs, the luxurious attic-styled master with ensuite and city skyline views, while split system heating/cooling, copious internal storage, European laundry, secure entry and carport ensure year-round comfort and security. Set amongst the community spirited in a well-maintained block, it proves the ideal low-maintenance home or savvy addition to any investment portfolio.
Insights: 5/7 William Street, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2019 and 25 other 3 bedroom house in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
Substantial Corner Classic With Scope & City Views
Capturing abundant north light and city skyline views from the corner of Page Street, the next exciting chapter in the life and times of this substantial Clifton Hill classic is firmly in your hands. This extra-wide tuckpointed brick Victorian is a unique double-storey discovery of original character, impressive proportions and remodeled living that's set to inspire the definitive inner-city revamp. Deep Page Street cul-de-sac frontage, spacious back garden and rear ROW enhance the remarkable potential of this rare four bedroom family residence on 199 sqms (approx.) just a short stroll to Gold Street Primary, Queens Parade cafes, Darling Gardens, trams and train station. The layout includes arched hallway, formal sitting room, living room adjoining dining area, kitchen, bathroom (shared to main bedroom), WC and laundry, plus high ceilings, timber floorboards, hydronic heating, open fireplaces and a rooftop terrace overlooking the city.
Insights: 454 Wellington Street, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2019 and 10 other 4 bedroom house in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
Classic Charm, Considerable Scope
Occupying a prestigious position directly opposite Darling Gardens in a tightly held pocket of Clifton Hill, this single level, generational family residence with two street frontages offers classic Victorian living with outstanding scope to renovate and extend (STCA).
Remaining in one family for almost 50 years, on a sizeable block measuring 460 sqm approx, with self contained studio, exquisite period features and established front garden.
A bright living area is complemented by an expansive formal dining area, accompanied by a functional kitchen with gas cooktop, oven and dishwasher.
Wide central arched hallway, three spacious bedrooms, a central bathroom with shower over inbuilt bath and fourth bedroom with ensuite.
The north facing courtyard features single garage, carport and a studio accessible via Turnbull Street.
Located moments from Queens Parade, Collingwood Leisure Centre and Clifton Hill train station, with excellent schooling close by.
Insights: 10 other 4 bedroom house in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
Vendor meets the Market With a Genuine Price
Our owners are keen to sell so instructed a significant reduction in price to lure the market to this very comfortable and attractive home with many enticing inclusions at not much over entry level for unrenovated homes in the area, particularly given the land size of 236m2 approx.
Lovingly cared for by its long time owners who are now making a move to rural Victoria this home presents as great value for money.
We know you'll question the locality but if you don't venture down and see what's going to change then you may just miss one of the better entry opportunities to Clifton Hill.
This delightful period brick home is on a larger than normal allotment of 235sqm with wide rear access to carport. Featuring two bedrooms from a wide hallway, central lounge with open fire place, stunning entertainers kitchen with meals keeping the action central, a period style bathroom renovation and separate laundry.
Featuring ducted reverse heating and cooling, polished boards, high ceilings, a northern side walkway allowing ample natural light and possible future extensions.
Insights: 51 Alexander Street, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2019 and 16 other 2 bedroom house in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
Inner-City Beauty & Brilliance
Triumph in the transformation of this wide three bedroom residence redefined in sophisticated style for superior quality inner-city living. The verve of an exciting village lifestyle is brilliantly reflected in the classic Hawthorn brick facade and fully-renovated, light-filled interior that flows with impeccable poise to a landscaped courtyard garden. Polished timber and concrete flooring set a smart contemporary tone matched by crisp, clean-lined spaces and high-spec features including central heating, air-conditioning and premium glazing. This vibrant Victorian offers stylish open-plan living and dining area with sliding doors to courtyard, stunning stone kitchen with excellent stainless-steel appliances, beautiful modern bathroom (freestanding bath), laundry and attic storage. A sought-after opportunity to immediately relax and enjoy, the central Clifton Hill location is quiet and convenient to nearby parkland and trails, train station, cafes, schools and Queens Parade shops.
Insights: 83 Spensley Street, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2019 and 25 other 3 bedroom house in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
Brand New in Exceptional Clifton Hill
Phone enquiry code for this property: 1032
Its not easy to find a brand-new apartment in the unbeatable location of Clifton Hill - an opportunity awaits.
This stunning and sizable one bedroom residence maximises its northerly aspect taking in the delights over-looking the village scene and has all the ingredients for a perfect city lifestyle. Ideally close to schools, transport options, shops, cafes and the beautiful Darling Gardens.
Designed by renowned Idle Architects and one of only 13 residences, this contemporary and stylish development sold overwhelmingly to owner occupiers and downsizers looking to stay in the area, is due for completion, June 2019.
An open plan living/dining area basks in natural light, opening onto a sheltered terrace through full height double glazed doors. A sleek kitchen highlighted by quality finishes boasts oak and crisp white joinery, pendant light, Miele appliances including gas cooktop, oven and dishwasher, natural stone benchtop and splashback, abundant storage and features oak timber floors throughout. A generous private bedroom includes BIRs and study nook. The bathroom has clean lines, seamless glass walk-in shower and storage options. Finished with European laundry, reverse cycle heating/cooling, secure video entrance with lift entry and secure off street parking - this is it, look no further.
Call Sheree to make a private appointment before completion in June.
Phone enquiry code for this property: 1032
Insights: 203/247 Gold Street, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2019 and 12 other 1 bedroom unit in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
Spacious & Elegant Victorian
Pristinely presented, this Victorian home showcases immaculate period features in a tightly held pocket of Clifton Hill. Located on a peaceful street, this single level residence benefits from an instantly appealing facade and a flowing floorplan. An inviting living area featuring a gas fireplace and reverse cycle air conditioning opens to a rear courtyard with alfresco dining area to be enjoyed all year round, creating a seamless indoor/outdoor entertaining space. A separate dining area opens out to a lightwell courtyard and adjoins a well appointed kitchen with Miele gas cooktop, oven and dishwasher. Both generous bedrooms feature built in robes and decorative ceiling elements, and a bright bathroom features bath and laundry facilities. A storage shed is placed at the rear of the home. Parking for one vehicle is accessible via rear laneway. Positioned close to Darling Gardens, Clifton Hill train station and Queens Parade shopping and amenities.
Insights: 34 Rutland Street, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2019 and 16 other 2 bedroom house in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
Charming Victorian terrace in a prized Clifton Hill location
Featuring the unusual commodity of a double carport at the rear with right of way access, this charming single fronted terrace combines Victorian character and low maintenance living across one immaculate level. Enjoying an enviable inner Melbourne address, it is ideally positioned in a leafy area just a short stroll to Clifton Hill village, cosmopolitan Smith Street and Darling Garden with your pick of transport options. Beyond the impressive, welcoming faÃ§ade are two generous bedrooms with built-ins off the arched hallway. At the heart of the home is a bright living and dining room that opens onto a covered entertaining deck and private sun soaked patio. A smart gas kitchen with a dishwasher, and a good sized bathroom with laundry facilities complete the functional layout. Features include high ceilings with rosettes, polished floorboards and a garden shed.

Description:
Spacious Victorian home in an enviable Clifton Hill enclave
Enjoying a desirable inner city address in one of Clifton Hill's best streets, this comfortable Victorian home presents space, character and scope to update as you desire. It is ideally placed just a short stroll to village cafes, city trains, Merri Creek Trail, a host of beautiful parklands and schools. Beyond a wide street frontage and double brick faÃ§ade, the foyer leads to a superb front lounge or bedroom with an original fireplace, three generous additional bedrooms including two with built-in robes, and a bright bathroom with a bath, shower and separate w/c. Drenched in natural light at the back is a well kept kitchen with European appliances and a breakfast bar, and an open plan living and dining area that flows onto a large sunny entertaining courtyard in private garden surrounds. It features a separate laundry with courtyard access, hydronic heating, split system air-conditioning, high ceilings throughout, polished floorboards and convenient side access.
